props.summary:
Here’s a structured summary of the **core topics, concepts, principles, and equations** (where applicable) for the **Diploma Level: Modern Application Development I** exam, along with **Mermaid knowledge graphs** to visualize relationships. --- --- ## **Core Topics & Concepts Summary** ### **1. Flask (Python Web Framework)** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Routing**: Define URLs and map them to functions using `@app.route`. - Trailing slashes (`/about` vs `/about/`) redirect automatically in Flask. - Example: ```python @app.route('/home') def home(): return "Home" ``` - **HTTP Methods**: - `GET`: Fetch data (avoid for sensitive data; data appears in URL/browser history). - `POST`: Submit data (secure for sensitive data). - Example: ```python @app.route('/login', methods=['POST']) def login(): pass ``` - **Request Handling**: - Access query parameters: `request.args.get('param')`. - Access form data: `request.form.get('param')`. - Abort requests: `abort(404, "Not Found")`. - **Templates (Jinja2)**: - Extend base templates using `{% extends "base.html" %}`. - Define blocks: `{% block content %}{% endblock %}`. - Render templates: `render_template('file.html', data=dict)`. - **Error**: Content must be inside blocks to render (e.g., `home.html` extending `base.html`). - **Template Folders**: - Default: `templates/`. - Custom: `app = Flask(__name__, template_folder='custom_templates')`. - **Flask-SQLAlchemy**: - Define models: ```python class Author(db.Model): id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True) books = db.relationship('Book', cascade="all, delete") ``` - **Cascade Options**: - `cascade="all, delete"`: Deleting an `Author` deletes all related `Book` records. - **Lazy Loading**: - `lazy='dynamic'`: Returns a query object for filtering (e.g., `author.books.filter(...)`). - **Flask-RESTful**: - Define resources: ```python class StudentResource(Resource): def get(self, student_id): return {"id": student_id} api.add_resource(StudentResource, '/students/') ``` - **HTTP Status Codes**: - `200 OK`, `201 Created`, `204 No Content`, `400 Bad Request`, `404 Not Found`. #### **Key Equations/Logic (Flask):** - **Grade Calculation** (from Q31–Q33): ```python if marks >= 90: grade = "A" elif marks >= 75: grade = "B" elif marks >= 60: grade = "C" else: grade = "F" ``` --- ### **2. SQLAlchemy (ORM)** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Relationships**: - One-to-Many: `db.relationship('ChildModel', backref='parent')`. - **Foreign Keys**: `db.ForeignKey('parent.id')`. - **Session Management**: - Add objects: `db.session.add(obj)`. - Commit: `db.session.commit()`. - **Querying**: - Filter: `Student.query.filter_by(id=2).first()`. - Dynamic loading: `lazy='dynamic'` (returns a query object). --- ### **3. Git & Version Control** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Branching/Merging**: - Merge `feature1` and `feature2` into `main`: ```bash git checkout main git merge feature1 git merge feature2 ``` - **Conflict Resolution**: - If remote has new changes, `git push` fails. Resolve with: ```bash git pull # Fetch and merge git push # Push resolved changes ``` - **Git Commands**: - `git status`, `git add .`, `git commit -m "msg"`, `git push`, `git pull`. --- ### **4. HTML/CSS/JavaScript** #### **Key Concepts:** - **HTML Structure**: - Block vs. inline elements: - Block: `
`, `

` (start on new lines). - Inline: ``, ``, `` (flow with text). - **CSS Styling**: - Bold text: `style.fontWeight = "bold"` (JS) or `font-weight: bold` (CSS). - Borders: `border: 1px solid black` (not `border-colour`). - **JavaScript DOM Manipulation**: - Access elements: `document.getElementById("id")`. - Modify styles: `element.style.property = "value"`. --- ### **5. Testing (Pytest)** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Test Naming**: Functions must start with `test_`. - **Markers**: Categorize tests (e.g., `@pytest.mark.unit`). - **Assertions**: ```python assert function(input) == expected_output ``` - **Fixtures**: Simulate isolated environments. - **Command Examples**: - Run unit tests: `pytest -m unit`. - Exclude slow tests: `pytest -m "not slow"`. #### **Key Outputs (Pytest):** - **Pass/Fail**: ``` FAILED test_file.py::TestClass::test_method - AssertionError: Message ``` - **Deselected Tests**: Skipped if markers don’t match. --- ### **6. HTTP & Web Concepts** #### **Key Concepts:** - **HTTP Methods**: - `GET`: Data in URL (insecure for sensitive data). - `POST`: Data in request body (secure). - **Status Codes**: - `200 OK`, `201 Created`, `400 Bad Request`, `404 Not Found`, `422 Unprocessable Entity`. - **URL Encoding**: Avoid spaces/special characters in URLs. - **Bandwidth Calculation**: - **Formula**: ``` Time (seconds) = File Size (MB) × 8 / Speed (Mbps) ``` - Example: 10 MB file at 5 Mbps → `10 × 8 / 5 = 16` seconds. --- ### **7. RESTful APIs** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Endpoints**: - `/students` (collection), `/students/` (single resource). - **HTTP Verbs**: - `GET`: Retrieve, `POST`: Create, `PUT`: Update, `DELETE`: Remove. - **Request Parsing** (Flask-RESTful): ```python parser = reqparse.RequestParser() parser.add_argument('name', required=True) args = parser.parse_args() ``` - **Response Codes**: - `201 Created`, `204 No Content`, `400 Bad Request` (missing fields). --- ### **8. Nielsen’s Usability Heuristics** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Visibility of System Status**: Keep users informed (e.g., show error messages for wrong credentials). - **Error Prevention**: Design to minimize mistakes. - **Recognition Over Recall**: Make options visible (e.g., auto-fill forms). --- ### **9. Browser vs. Server Responsibilities** | **Browser** | **Server (Flask)** | |---------------------------|-----------------------------| | Parses HTML/CSS/JS | Renders templates | | Auto-fills forms | Handles URL routing | | Executes JavaScript | Processes HTTP requests | --- ### **10. Logging (Python)** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Log Levels**: `DEBUG`, `INFO`, `WARNING`, `ERROR`, `CRITICAL`. - **Configuration**: ```python logging.basicConfig(level=logging.WARNING, format='%(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s') ``` - **Log Messages**: ```python logging.error("Error: %s", message) # Only shows if level >= ERROR ``` --- --- ## **Mermaid Knowledge Graphs** ### **1. Flask Core Concepts** ```mermaid graph TD A[Flask] --> B[Routing] A --> C[Templates] A --> D[Request Handling] A --> E[SQLAlchemy Integration] A --> F[RESTful APIs] B --> B1["@app.route('/path')"] B --> B2["HTTP Methods: GET, POST"] C --> C1["Jinja2 Syntax"] C --> C2["Template Inheritance"] C --> C3["render_template()"] D --> D1["request.args"] D --> D2["request.form"] D --> D3["abort(404)"] E --> E1["Models & Relationships"] E --> E2["Querying"] E --> E3["Session Management"] F --> F1["Flask-RESTful"] F --> F2["Resource Classes"] F --> F3["HTTP Status Codes"] ``` ### **2. Git Workflow** ```mermaid graph LR A[Local Changes] -->|git add| B[Staging] B -->|git commit| C[Local Repository] C -->|git push| D[Remote Repository] D -->|git pull| C C -->|Conflict| E[Resolve Merge] E -->|git commit| C ``` ### **3. HTTP Methods & Status Codes** ```mermaid graph TD A[HTTP Methods] --> B[GET] A --> C[POST] A --> D[PUT] A --> E[DELETE] B --> B1["Fetch Data"] B --> B2["200 OK"] C --> C1["Submit Data"] C --> C2["201 Created"] D --> D1["Update Data"] D --> D2["200 OK"] E --> E1["Delete Data"] E --> E2["204 No Content"] F[Error Codes] --> F1["400 Bad Request"] F --> F2["404 Not Found"] F --> F3["422 Unprocessable Entity"] ``` ### **4. Testing Pyramid (Pytest)** ```mermaid graph TD A[Testing] --> B[Unit Tests] A --> C[Integration Tests] A --> D[System Tests] B --> B1["Test individual functions"] B --> B2["@pytest.mark.unit"] C --> C1["Test component interactions"] C --> C2["@pytest.mark.integration"] D --> D1["End-to-end workflows"] D --> D2["@pytest.mark.slow"] ``` ### **5. HTML/CSS/JS Relationship** ```mermaid graph LR A[HTML] -->|Structure| B[DOM] B -->|Styled by| C[CSS] B -->|Manipulated by| D[JavaScript] C --> C1["Inline: style='color: red'"] C --> C2["External: link rel='stylesheet'"] D --> D1["document.getElementById()"] D --> D2["addEventListener()"] ``` ### **6. SQLAlchemy Relationships** ```mermaid graph TD A[Author] -->|One-to-Many| B[Book] A -->|Cascade| C["all, delete"] B -->|Foreign Key| A A --> A1["id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)"] B --> B1["author_id = db.ForeignKey('author.id')"] ``` ### **7. Flask-RESTful Resource Flow** ```mermaid graph TD A[Client Request] --> B[Flask-RESTful] B --> C[Resource Class] C --> D[GET/POST/PUT/DELETE Methods] D --> E[Response] E --> E1["200 OK"] E --> E2["201 Created"] E --> E3["400 Bad Request"] ``` --- --- ## **Key Equations (Math-Related)** 1. **Bandwidth Time Calculation**: \[ \text{Time (seconds)} = \frac{\text{File Size (MB)} \times 8}{\text{Speed (Mbps)}} \] - Example: 10 MB at 5 Mbps → \( \frac{10 \times 8}{5} = 16 \) seconds. 2. **Grade Logic**: ```python if marks >= 90: grade = "A" elif marks >= 75: grade = "B" elif marks >= 60: grade = "C" else: grade = "F" ``` 3. **Modulus Operation** (from Q11, Q12): \[ \text{Result} = \text{number} \% \text{MULTIPLIER} \] - Example: `4 % 5 = 4`.
